examples: In 1821 the selectmen were petitioned to lay out a new road in Hampton, beginning at Vittum's corner, so called, [junction of Towle Farm Road & Exeter Road] and running to the line of Hampton Falls at the shunpike bridge, so called.

verbs.description: shunpike (third-person singular simple present shunpikes, present participle shunpiking, simple past and past participle shunpiked)

entries.meaning: To travel by side roads so as to avoid the toll roads or turnpikes.
